results.title: [Ch'u Fou: birthplace of Confucius]
results.brief_description: Documentary film about Ch’u Fou, Shantung Province, the birthplace of K’ung-Fu-Tze (Confucius, 551-478 B.C.). Examples of the architecture, art and sculpture of this period are shown including the Chinese Classroom, built many centuries later in dedication to the memory of Confucius and his democratic ideal of a classless education. Temples, stone carvings and ancient Chinese culture are luxuriously presented in this historically informative film. English language, Chinese title and credits.
results.description: Documentary film about Ch’u Fou, Shantung Province, the birthplace of K’ung-Fu-Tze (Confucius, 551-478 B.C.). results.title: [CENSORED]
results.creator_credit: Arenamedia, Chloé Brugalé and Sari Braithwaite
results.brief_description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.
description_for_label: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [CENSORED] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Industrial Life]
results.brief_description: Originally established for the storing and handling of commercial explosives, the reserve is one of Altona’s few intact examples of its rich industrial history. This animation brings to life the story of explosives, the working life of the Truganina Explosives Reserve and its place in the history of Melbourne’s western region.
results.description: Originally established for the storing and handling of commercial explosives, the reserve is one of Altona’s few intact examples of its rich industrial history. results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Flora and Fauna]
results.brief_description: Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona is an environmental wonderland, containing rare flora and fauna. Much of the original landscape has remained untouched for over 100 years. This takes us back to a time when it was formally landscaped, and representative of the early Edwardian planting of the late 1880s. Please enjoy a serene journey through the reserve, celebrating this unique ecosystem.

results.title: [Caulfield Technical College Annual Review, 1966]
results.brief_description: An example of student film making. The surfer, riding a child’s tricycle with his surfboard under his arm, enters a park, splashes across an ornamental pond and land-surfs under a sprinkler. No title, no credits available.

results.title: [Cattle breeding in UK]
results.brief_description: Showing off bulls of various cattle in UK. These animals are specifically bred to withstand extreme climatic conditions and to fend for themselves either in UK or other countries like South America. Breeds shown include: Herefords Devon, Aberdeen Angus and Shorthorns. The Shorthorns are bred for beef and milk. Short snippet of King George, Queen Elizabeth and the two princesses at a cattle show.
